paper_abstract: This paper visually demonstrates water entry of horizontal hydrophobic circular cylinders, 12 mm in diameter and 300 mm long, by three types of coating of a water-repellent material; (a) perfectly coated, (b) right half surface coated, and (c) stripe coated. After the entry of the cylinder into water, the hydrophobic surface of the cylinder forms an air cavity behind it, whereas the hydrophilic surface is perfectly wetted. As a result, the resulting cavities are found to independently grow and break off from the cylinder even for the Type (c).
paper_title: Water entry of stripe-coated hydrophobic circular cylinders
